main_definition: Immunology is the scientific study of the immune system, which defends organisms against diseases and pathogens.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idiom or slang term referring to an individual's resistance to disease
meanings_and_examples.example: After receiving her flu shot, Jane felt more immunologically secure during the cold season.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A branch of medicine dealing with disorders of the immune system
meanings_and_examples.example: Immunology research has led to breakthroughs in treating autoimmune diseases such as lupus and rheumatoid arthritis.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The study of how organisms protect themselves from foreign substances or pathogens
meanings_and_examples.example: Studying immunology helps scientists understand why some people are more susceptible to infections than others.
